newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian living costs fall slightly in August.
newsitem.headline: Croatian living costs fall slightly in August.

text.p: Monthly living costs in Croatia were 0.8 percent lower in August after a 1.0 percent decrease in goods prices, the Central Bureau of Statistics reported on Wednesday.
However, they rose 5.3 percent between January and August this year compared with a year ago. August's year-on-year increase was 6.0 percent, according to official figures.
The price of food, estimated to account for more than a half of basic living costs, fell 2.2 percent on a monthly level. Clothing, drinks and tobacco rose marginally.
Rents were down 0.2 percent from July, while increasing 1.3 percent from August 1995.
Services prices eased 0.1 percent for the first time this year. But due to an earlier uncontrolled increase, they were a whole 10.0 percent higher than a year ago.

Monthly retail price inflation was flat in August. But with another four months until the end of 1996, it stood at 4.7 percent on an annual level, just within the 3-5 percent target. -- Kolumbina Bencevic, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
